title: Will military retirees get a pay raise this year like the one active duty members received? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Retiree pay is calculated once when you retire. The exception is if you are recalled to active duty. If so, your retired pay will be recalculated upon your release from active duty using the system you fall under such as final pay or High-36. While receiving retired pay, annual pay increases are based on the annual cost of living percentage calculated by the Department of Labor and is the same as increase applied to Social Security payments. For 2020, the COLA is 1.6%.

Yes and no. Retirees typically receive a Cost of Living Allowance or COLA adjustment every year, but it is not directly tied to the military pay raise. Members of the military will be receiving a 3.1% pay raise for 2020, retirees will be receiving a COLA adjustment of 1.6%. Here's Your 2020 Military Retiree, VA and Social Security Pay Bump
